snippet: The Afghan police said two insurgents had confessed to having killed the writer, Sushmita Banerjee, who had written critically about the Taliban.
abstract: Afghan police arrest two militants in the execution-style murder of Indian writer Sushmita Banerjee, who had written critically about the Taliban; officials say two insurgents confessed to being part of the Haqqani Network.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and SHARIFULLAH SAHAK

lead_paragraph: The Afghan police said two insurgents had confessed to having killed the writer, Sushmita Banerjee, who had written critically about the Taliban.

headline.main: 2 Held in Afghanistan in Indian Writer’s Killing
headline.print_headline:
Afghanistan: Two Militants Arrested
In the Killing of an Indian Writer
